summary: This bill, the Colonel Young Oak Kim Congressional Gold Medal Act, proposes to posthumously award a Congressional Gold Medal to Colonel Young Oak Kim. The bill details Kim's extraordinary heroism, leadership, and humanitarian contributions, including his service in World War II and the Korean War, as well as his post-military work founding organizations supporting Korean Americans, promoting cultural understanding, and providing social services. The bill authorizes the Speaker of the House and the President pro tempore of the Senate to arrange the presentation, mandates the design and striking of the medal by the Secretary of the Treasury, and provides for the medal's display at the Smithsonian Institution.
